intro: Elephantopus welwitschii, commonly known as the African groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in open, sunny habitats and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
